greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Self-inverse permutation of natural numbers: a(n) = A263273(4*n) / 4.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..4921
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of related permutations:
A000035(a(n)) = A000035(n). [This permutation preserves the parity of n.]
A264978(n) = a(2n)/2. [Thus the restriction onto even numbers induces yet another permutation.]
program: def a030102(n): return 0 if n==0 else int(''.join(map(str, digits(n, 3)[1:][::-1])), 3)
return 1 if n==1 else reduce(mul, [1 if i==3 else i**f[i] for i in f])
def a(n): return a263273(4*n)/4 # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 25 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 05 2015
